Package controller

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • moteur.Observable
      • controller.GameController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class GameController
extends Observable
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The class GameController is the core of our projet, it is a controller who ensures all the smooth operations of the game.

    GameController puts most objects together. It can be regarded as a room in which there sits all players, and also a table, with all cards on it.

    Like it should be in the real world, one game, should and should only have a certain number of players, which are fixed or in this case here, selected, in advance, at the very begining of the game. The process of selecting the player number no matter the player is real or virtual, including setting the level of difficulity, is in the charge of the views. So GameController naturally uses the Design Pattern Singleton, which enables itself to have only one instance running at a time.

    GameController has attributs and methodes in order to let itself capable of :

    • starting the game by giving the initial parameters : number of players, how many of them are real and the level of the game
    • creating and initializing a whole suite of cards (17 in total)
    • distributing the cards to the right place, including the DrawDeck, Offer and Jest of each player, the Stack or to the Trophie
    • shuffling the cards
    • dealing the cards at each turn and finding which player should begin, according to the rule, the player whose face-up card has the highest face value takes the first turn.
    • returning the instance of GameController, the number of players, their names, the cards, etc. This is for the programme, do not make sense in the real circumstance.

    The class GameController implements Runnable, as a thread, it should be able to run simultaneously together with other small threads, like wait for the user to make the choice, by both using the graphic interface or the way of commande line.

    See Also:
    gameConfigDialog

      • getInstance

        public static GameController getInstance()
        getInstance returns the instance of the class GameController, by firstly checking its existance, if it exists already, return, if not, create a new one by using new ObjectName(). This represents the Design Pattern Singleton
        Returns:
        GameController

      • start

        public void start​(int numPlayer,
                  int numPlayerReal,
                  int level)
        The essential part of the card gane. start initialize the cards, the players, then shuffle the cards, deal cards to the trophie, then ask players to choose one card face up, then choose an offer.
        Parameters:
        numPlayer - The number of players
        numPlayerReal - The number of real players
        level - The level of the game

      • dealCardsFromDrawDeckToPlayer

        public void dealCardsFromDrawDeckToPlayer()
        First, dealCardsFromDrawDeckToPlayer shuffles the cards in this.drawDeck, then it gives each player 2 cards from this.drawDeck, add them to players' offer, finally it deletes the cards from this.drawDeck.
        See Also:
        DrawDeck

      • dealCardsFromStackToPlayer

        public void dealCardsFromStackToPlayer()
        First, dealCardsFromStackToPlayer shuffles the cards in the this.stack, then it gives each player 2 cards from this.stack, add them to players' offer, finally it deletes the cards from this.stack by using poll.

        The methode should notify all the players, as the observers, so player.setChanged() and player.notifyObservers().

        See Also:
        Stack

      • dealCardsFromDrawDeckToTrophie

        public void dealCardsFromDrawDeckToTrophie()
        First, dealCardsFromDrawDeckToTrophie() shuffles the cards in this.stack, then it gives out 2 ore 3 cards as the trophies, by adding them to this.trophies, then delete the cards from this.drawDeck
        See Also:
        Stack

      • findTheBiggestValueFaceup

        public void findTheBiggestValueFaceup()
        Compare the face-up cards in each offer. The player whose face-up card has the highest face value takes the first turn.

        The methode findTheBiggestValueFaceup() check every offer card of each player, by comparing the value and the color with the temporary variables maxNum and maxCouleur, then replace if needed.

      • recyleCard

        public void recyleCard()
        In later rounds, first collect up the cards not taken from the players鈥� offers in the previous round (each player will have 1 card remaining in front of them) and place these cards in a face-down stack. Then add to the stack a number of cards from the draw deck equal to the number of players. Shuffle this stack and deal 2 cards to each player.

      • takeNumPlayerCardsFromDeckToStack

        public void takeNumPlayerCardsFromDeckToStack()
        In later rounds, first collect up the cards... Then add to the stack a number of cards from the draw deck equal to the number of players.

      • restart

        public void restart​(int a,
                    int b,
                    int c)
        To restart the game, just call this methode.

        it emptys the playerList and the finalPointList. Then it calls start(int numPlayer,int numPlayerReal,int level) in class GameController

        Parameters:
        a - int, the number of players
        b - int, the number of real players
        c - int, the level of the game

      • run

        public void run()
        When an object implementing interface Runnable is used to create a thread, starting the thread causes the object's run method to be called in that separately executing thread.

        The general contract of the method run is that it may take any action whatsoever.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
